required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: McGrath vs. C-MAC Video Laryngoscopy Comparison in Endotracheal Tube Insertion
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness Comparison Between McGrath and C-MAC Video Laryngoscope in Endotracheal Tube Insertion

brief_summary.textblock:
Tracheal intubation is commonly performed using a standard Macintosh blade, but recently there has been advanced technology using video laryngoscopy (VL).In this modern era, there are various types of available VL to make it easier for anesthesiologists to perform intubation, especially in patients with difficult airway anatomy.
Various studies showed different results regarding the effectiveness of both C-MAC® and McGrath®, by assessing the comparison of the effectiveness, valuable information will be obtained for further consideration by experts in choosing the best tools in the future.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From first intubation attempt until successful intubation, an average of one minute
primary_outcome.description: Time required to perform intubation until endotracheal tube is properly positioned

primary_outcome.time_frame: From first intubation attempt until successful intubation, an average of two minutes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first intubation attempt until successful intubation, an average of one minute
secondary_outcome.description: The number of times required for a successful intubation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During first intubation attempt, an average of 30 seconds
secondary_outcome.description: Visualization of glottic assessed by the POGO (Percentage of Glottis Opening) score, 1=best, 4=worst

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first intubation attempt until successful intubation, an average of one minute
secondary_outcome.description: Includes orotracheal trauma, presence of blood in the blades, laryngospasm, bradycardia

intervention.description: Endotracheal intubation using either McGrath or C-MAC video laryngoscopy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Elective surgery patients without neck and face trauma
2. Undergo surgery requiring general anesthesia with endotracheal intubation
3. Patients with physical status ASA I-III
4. Patients aged 18-65 years
5. Nutritional status (BMI < 35 Kg/m2)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients refusal to be included in the study
2. Patients with cervical spine instability
3. Anatomical and structural abnormalities of the maxillary teeth
4. Thyromental distance <6 cm and inter-incisor distance <3.5 cm
5. History of difficult intubation
6. LEMON criteria ≥ 3
